references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of adversarial machine learning, introducing the concept of adversarial examples and their significance.
This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a crucial component of the proposed CausalDiff model.

references.paper_title: Towards deep learning models resistant to adversarial attacks
references.reason: This paper significantly advanced adversarial training techniques, a key defense method considered in the paper.

references.paper_title: Learning causal semantic representation for out-of-distribution prediction
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of learning causal representations which is directly related to the causality focus of the CausalDiff model.

references.paper_title: Robust classification via a single diffusion model
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it also uses diffusion models for adversarial robustness and is a state-of-the-art method that CausalDiff is compared against.
